metadata.title: CVE-2020-12654 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - high
metadata.description:
An issue was found in Linux kernel before 5.5.4.mwifiex_ret_wmm_get_status() in drivers/net/wireless/marvell/mwifiex/wmm.callows a remote AP to trigger a heap-based buffer overflow because of anincorrect memcpy, aka CID-3a9b153c5591.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12654` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
